title: Mario Mutsch - Wikipedia
snippet: Born in St. Vith, Mutsch started his career at Belgian lower leagues sides Spa and Kelmis (La Calamine) before heading to Germany to play for the Alemannia Aachen reserve team.

title: Mario Mutsch
snippet: Gallen emphasized team stability, where he formed part of the defensive midfield structure that supported the club's mid-table consistency in the Super League during those years. Across his Swiss clubs from 2011 to 2017, he accumulated approximately 174 appearances, underscoring his longevity in the league.[18] After six years abroad, primarily in Switzerland, Mario Mutsch returned to Luxembourgish football by signing a free transfer with Progrès Niederkorn on 1 July 2017, following his departure from FC St.
